channel.title: Init - David Vargas
channel.description: System V Overview (sys v) (“system five”) - init stops and starts essential processes - 3 major versions of init 1. system V (most traditional version) 2. upstart 3. syst - Starts and stops processes sequentially - uses scripts to start and stop processes - Easy to solve dependencies (A comes before B) - Con: Only one service stops or starts at a time. - State of the machine is defined by runlevels (0-6) (varies by distro)
